text:

author: info@kalkinemedia.com (EIN Presswire)
title: OilMENA Unveils the Top 10 Oil and Gas Companies to Watch in 2024
text:
EINPresswire.com/ -- 1. ExxonMobil: Leading the Way with Expertise and Innovation
As a major player in the oil and gas business, ExxonMobil sets the bar by utilizing its many years of knowledge in the field. The firm is dedicated to innovation and keeps pushing the frontiers of energy production and exploration.
Known for its tenacity and flexibility, ExxonMobil continues to be a major force in determining how the oil and gas industry will develop in the future by continuously investigating cutting-edge innovations and environmentally friendly procedures.
2. Chevron: Reliability and Sustainability in Focus
In the oil and gas sector, Chevron is distinguished by its steadfast dedication to sustainability and dependability. Known for its strong operating procedures, Chevron is a steady force in the world of energy. Chevron’s focus on sustainability not only satisfies environmental concerns but also establishes the business as a progressive player in a cutthroat industry, solidifying its ranking as one of the top oil and gas companies to watch in 2024.
3. Shell: Diversification and Renewable Energy Leadership
Shell is a prominent participant in the market thanks to its diverse portfolio and leadership in renewable energy efforts. Shell is putting a lot of money into sustainable technology and going beyond conventional oil and gas operations to take the lead in the rapidly changing energy sector. Shell is adjusting to shifting customer preferences and regulatory developments with a strategic focus on sustainability, which makes it a crucial firm to keep an eye on in 2024.
4. BP: Pioneering the Transition to a Low-Carbon Future
Leading the way in the industry’s shift to a low-carbon future, BP is creating waves. Acknowledging the need for change, the corporation is actively involved in carbon reduction and renewable energy projects. With its commitment to sustainable practices and strategy shift in line with global efforts to address climate change, BP is redefining its place in the oil and gas industry and positioning itself as a corporation with a revolutionary agenda for 2024.
5. Saudi Aramco: Global Energy Influence and Strategic Investments
Saudi Aramco, a major player in the global energy sector, continues to have significant sway over the oil and gas industry. The corporation, which is well-known for its astute investments and unmatched production skills, is a major force behind the development of the worldwide energy scene.
The decisions made by Saudi Aramco have a significant impact, and the company’s standing as a major competitor is enhanced by its aptitude at navigating the intricacies of the rapidly evolving energy market.
6. TotalEnergies: Leading the Charge in Sustainability
Leading the charge in the oil and gas sector’s sustainability drive is TotalEnergies. Through a deliberate transition towards sustainable energy solutions, the organisation is proactively mitigating its carbon emissions. To demonstrate its dedication to a greener and more sustainable energy future, TotalEnergies is making significant investments in solar, wind, and bioenergy projects.
Their cutting-edge methods of using carbon capture and storage technology are attracting notice and demonstrating their commitment to environmental responsibility. TotalEnergies distinguishes among the industry’s transformational efforts due to its progressive measures that support international efforts to tackle climate change.
7. ConocoPhillips: Efficiency and Resource Maximization
ConocoPhillips has distinguished itself from the competition by emphasising resource optimisation and operational efficiency. The business is successfully navigating the competitive terrain thanks to efficient operations and a dedication to getting the most value possible from every resource.
ConocoPhillips stands out for its capacity to adjust to shifting market conditions while keeping a close eye on sustainability. ConocoPhillips is still a major actor in the changing story of the oil and gas industry as it pursue technological and operational improvements.
8. PetroChina: Pioneering Technological Advancements
PetroChina’s dedication to technical improvements highlights its impact in the global energy sector. The corporation, a significant participant, has welcomed innovation in all facets of its business, from production to exploration. Strategic investments made by PetroChina in cutting-edge technology like data analytics and artificial intelligence help to boost production and efficiency.
With a focus on remaining at the forefront of technical advancement, their forward-thinking strategy places them as a key player in determining the direction of the industry.
9. Gazprom: Shaping the Future of Natural Gas
Gazprom is still a major player in the natural gas industry and has a major impact on how the world’s energy market is shaped. Gazprom is a significant natural gas provider, hence its strategic choices have an effect on the regional and global energy markets.
The rising significance of greener energy sources is in line with the company’s concentration on sustainable and dependable natural gas production. Gazprom’s position as a major actor in the changing dynamics of the oil and gas business is a result of its creative projects and geopolitical clout.
10. Eni: Commitment to Diversified and Sustainable Energy
Eni’s steadfast dedication to a varied and sustainable energy portfolio is garnering attention. Eni is positioned as a leader in the energy transition because of its strategic focus on renewable energy sources and technological innovations.
By making investments in bioenergy, solar power, and wind power, Eni is actively supporting the worldwide movement towards greener energy sources. The way Eni approaches their business, integrating sustainability into all facets of their operations, sets them apart as a firm with a bright future in the continuously evolving oil and gas sector.
Conclusion
To sum up, the Top 10 Oil and Gas Companies of 2024 present a wide range of strategies for addressing the possibilities and difficulties in the constantly changing energy industry. These businesses, which range from industry titans like ExxonMobil and Chevron to cutting-edge contenders like TotalEnergies and Eni, are reshaping the energy landscape.
With an increasing focus on sustainability and technology innovations, the sector is undergoing substantial changes, and the Top 10 firms featured in this book are leading these developments. Keep a watch on these business titans as they make progress toward a more efficient and sustainable future by navigating the difficulties of a changing energy landscape.
Mowafag Ragas

author: Noemi Morucci
title: Un ex-eurodeputato italiano dovrà restituire 250mila euro al Parlamento europeo
text:
Bruxelles – Un ex-europarlamentare italiano del Ppe è stato definitivamente condannato dalla Corte di giustizia dell’Ue a pagare 250mila euro per frode al Parlamento europeo . Al centro delle verifiche dell’ufficio anti-frode del Parlamento ( Olaf ), l’assunzione fittizia di un’assistente parlamentare e il pagamento di somme ad una società, di cui l’assistente era l’unica socia.
LOlaf ha aperto il fascicolo a carico di Crescenzio Rivellini (Fi/Ppe), presente a Bruxelles dal 2009 al 2014 nei popolari. L’ufficio anti-frode dell’Ue ha indagato sull’ assunzione della sua assistente parlamentare , visti i 25mila euro richiesti come rimborso per le spese e l’assenza di documenti che provassero il suo lavoro e sugli oltre 220mila euro richiesti per l’esecuzione dei cosiddetti “contratti controversi” .
Questi contratti sarebbero stati stipulati con una società che avrebbe prestato servizi a Rivellini durante il suo mandato. Peccato che la società avesse come unica socia la sua assistente , che, tra parentesi, era anche la compagna storica dell’eurodeputato , come lui stesso dice nel suo libro (“Bianca Maria D’Angelo era da dieci anni la compagna della mia vita”, per citarne un estratto).
‘Bonnie e Clyde all’europea’ sono stati scoperti dall’Olaf e l’ ex-parlamentare europeo condannato dalla Corte di giustizia dell’Ue . Rivellini non avrebbe mai fornito alcuna prova dell’impiego effettivo di D’Angelo, sfruttando la presunta mancanza di chiarezza di quali siano i compiti che deve svolgere un assistente parlamentare.
L’ex esponente del Ppe ha cercato di oltrepassare le regole dello Statuto dei deputati del Parlamento europeo , che prevede la necessità di giustificare le spese anche per il personale alla dipendenza dei deputati. I giudici di Lussemburgo hanno chiarito che “ il deputato deve in particolare produrre i documenti giustificativi relativi alle attività dell’Assistente parlamentare e, pertanto, conservarli , e ciò anche in assenza di un obbligo esplicito”.
Rivellini ha tentato di dimostrare che D’Angelo avesse un badge per entrare , ma di nuovo la Corte ha smontato la sua tesi , stabilendo che “la sola presenza fisica dell’assistente parlamentare nei locali del Parlamento […] non può essere sufficiente a dimostrare l’effettività dell’esecuzione di compiti”. In aggiunta, D’Angelo non risiedeva nemmeno a Bruxelles nel periodo in cui, teoricamente, sarebbe stata quotidianamente impegnata nel lavoro in Parlamento.
Riguardo alle società, lo Statuto degli eurodeputati specifica che non ci debbano essere conflitti di interessi . Rivellini ha tentato di contestare la relazione tra lui e D’Angelo , nonostante il libro che diceva il contrario e che la Cgue ha potuto usare come prova. Un bell’autogol per l’ex eurodeputato, che ha scritto nero su bianco la sua autodenuncia e la presenza di un evidente conflitto di interessi.
In aggiunta, la validità dei versamenti effettuati non è mai stata provata dal Parlamento , mancando le “notifiche (del Parlamento) che certificano la regolarità dei pagamenti effettuati in virtù dei ‘contratti controversi'” e l’evidenza che i pagamenti fossero collegati ai contratti siglati. Per cui i 220mila euro non avevano assolutamente titolo per essere rimborsati dal Parlamento.
Da qui la condanna e la richiesta di risarcimento per Rivellini . Il quale, ironia della sorte, durante il suo mandato europeo è stato parte della commissione per il Controllo di bilancio , che si occupa di verificare la trasparenza e la gestione efficiente dei fondi europei, mantenendo stretti rapporto con l’ufficio anti-frode.

author: VNExplorer
title: E. coli ‘caught at Christmas market’ leaves teenage girl fighting for life
text:
Antonia Hay has had surgery and kidney failure since being infected with the deadly bacteria
A girl has been left fighting for her life after she caught a deadly strain of E. coli.
Antonia Hay, 17, is believed to have caught STEC-HUS, caused by E. coli O157, from food at a Christmas market.
The aspiring actress, has spent most of the past two weeks in intensive care, only coming home temporarily on Christmas Day.
She has had multiple operations, including to remove part of her bowel, and a blood transfusion as kidney failure has meant she requires dialysis, and left her feeling her “dreams have been ripped away” from her because she cannot continue her performing arts course.
Jemima Hay, her older sister, said: “She is lucky to be alive and has continued to show amazing determination and strength throughout this time, despite the immense stress, pain and trauma – all combined with an extreme phobia of injections.”
While the teenager is believed to have contracted E. coli from a Christmas market in November, it is not known what sort of food led to her catching it.
Antonia has had to give up her performing arts course because of the infection
She is one of 30 confirmed cases of E. coli across England and Scotland since late July 2023, with one person having died.
Most cases occurred in December, however, which sparked the Food Standards Agency (FSA) to issue a recall notice for four cheese products on Christmas Day.
The cheeses were Mrs Kirkham’s Mild and Creamy Lancashire, Mrs Kirkham’s Tasty Lancashire, Mrs Kirkham’s Mature Lancashire and Mrs Kirkham’s Smoked Lancashire, which were part of Christmas hampers.
A further notice was issued on Wednesday by the FSA for the Waitrose artisan No.1 Kirkham’s Lancashire product, all of which are made by the same company.
Cheese may have been in hampers Mrs Kirkham’s, an award-winning cheesemaker from Lancashire, makes its product in Goosnargh and is the only place in the world to still make raw milk Lancashire cheese.
“The cheeses are sometimes sold as a full block or served as individual portions and may have been provided as part of a hamper you’ve purchased or been gifted,” the FSA said.
“In some cases it’s been sold as part of a charcutier grazing platter. It may not always be clear whether you have purchased an affected product.”
Although E. coli is often transmitted via contaminated food, the UK Health Security Agency says it “can also be spread by close contact with an infected person, as well as direct contact with an infected animal”.
Steve Hay, Antonia’s father, believes it was caught from food at a local market in Great Missenden, Bucks.
“To anyone who may have experienced food poisoning symptoms at any restaurant, establishment or any market stall in Great Missenden during the Christmas Market, particularly on or from 25 November, please can you PM me,” he wrote on Facebook.
“My middle daughter is fighting for her life after a serious bacterial infection suspected from eating something around this time and we have strong theories, but just need to know if anyone else was affected with any level of stomach issues or illness.”
%n

author: Ian Mutuli
title: How Self-Storage Solutions Streamline Your Architecture Projects
text:
The sphere of architecture is complex, demanding, and continuously evolving. Effective administration and seamless availability of project resources are crucial in this arena. Architectural endeavors often involve various tangible elements that require secure, readily accessible storage.

Traditional storage methods can be limiting and ineffective. Hence, an innovative approach is needed. One such solution lies in self-storage solutions.\xa0


 What are Self-Storage Solutions? 


 Image Source: movinglabor.com

Self-storage solutions refer to facilities or services that offer individuals and businesses a secure and convenient way to store their belongings, equipment, or inventory for short or long periods. These storage units come in various sizes and types, allowing you to select the one that best suits your needs. Self-storage facilities are typically equipped with security features like surveillance cameras, access controls, and sturdy locks to ensure the safety of stored items.

These solutions are especially beneficial for architects and construction professionals who often require additional space to store project materials, tools, and documents. By utilizing self-storage, architects can efficiently manage their projects by keeping their workspace clutter-free, organized, and accessible. With the flexibility and cost-effectiveness of self-storage solutions, architects can focus on their projects’ creativity and execution without worrying about inadequate storage capacity or security concerns.

 Utilizing Self-Storage Units In Architecture Projects \xa0 


 Image Source: s1homes.com

Utilizing self-storage units in architectural projects has become increasingly popular and essential. These units provide architects with a streamlined solution for storing many project materials, including blueprints, models, and equipment. With self-storage, architects can conveniently organize and secure their project-related items in one central location, avoiding the hassle of cluttered office spaces.\xa0

One of the significant advantages of self-storage units is their affordability and flexibility. Renting a storage unit is a cost-effective alternative to renting additional office space or utilizing external storage facilities. Architects can rent a storage unit for as long as needed without being tied to long-term contracts. This allows for greater control over project costs and resources.\xa0

 1. Maintaining Project Efficiency \xa0 
Maintaining project efficiency is crucial in architecture projects, and this can be achieved through the proper use of self-storage units. Disorganization and chaos can arise when project items are scattered or cluttered in the office. However, self-storage solutions are streamlined by providing ample and secure storage space for project materials.\xa0

Self-storage units enable architects to store many project materials in one central location. They also offer the option for climate control, which is crucial for preserving delicate items such as drawings, blueprints, and scaled models. By mitigating the risk of damage to essential project items, architects can reduce costly delays and ensure that project timelines are met without compromising the quality of the outcomes.\xa0

 2. Tailoring Storage To Your Needs \xa0 
Self-storage units offer a versatile solution tailored to your specific storage needs. Whether you require a small team for storing drawings or a larger one for architectural models, you can find a size that fits your requirements.

Additionally, the flexibility of month-to-month rentals makes self-storage a cost-effective option for both short-term and long-term architecture projects.

 3. Facilitating Team Collaboration \xa0 
 Storage units offer more than just a place to store materials; they can become a central hub for team collaboration. When project materials are held together in one easily accessible location, team members can efficiently find, share, and discuss the resources they need.

This coordination greatly enhances communication and workflow, leading to a streamlined and productive working environment.

 4. Improving Accessibility And Security \xa0 
Moving on, accessibility is another essential benefit of using self-storage units. These facilities typically offer around-the-clock access, ensuring architects can retrieve their materials whenever necessary. Besides, high-security measures like CCTV surveillance , secure locks, and even on-site personnel contribute to the safety of your precious project components.\xa0

Consequently, architects can work with peace of mind, knowing their materials are safe and readily available when needed.\xa0

 5. Cutting Down On Office Clutter \xa0 
Having a cluttered office filled with project materials can hinder productivity. Self-storage units provide extra space to store these materials, reducing office clutter.

A tidy workspace boosts morale, enhances focus, and increases productivity, ensuring a more organized and efficient working environment for architects.

 6. Enabling Better Resource Management \xa0 
Beyond merely storing materials, self-storage units offer architects a way to manage resources effectively. By keeping a well-organized storage unit, professionals can easily take inventory of their materials.

They can track what they have, what they’re running low on, and what they need to acquire. This could save time, prevent wastage, and result in more cost-effective projects.\xa0

 7. Ensuring Business Continuity \xa0 
Self-storage units are also essential in ensuring business continuity during office renovation or relocation. It provides a secure place to store materials and equipment, allowing work to continue with minimal disruption.

This way, deadlines can be met, and the business of life can continue running smoothly.

 8. Providing Flexible Expansion \xa0 
As your architecture business grows, so will your need for storage space. Rather than incurring the high costs and inconveniences of moving to a larger office, self-storage units provide a flexible solution. Additional units can be rented as required, accommodating your growing business needs at a fraction of the cost.

 9. Supporting Sustainable Practices \xa0 
Using self-storage units in architecture supports sustainable practices by allowing architects to store and reuse materials, reducing waste. This promotes a more environmentally-friendly approach to their work.

In addition to the positive environmental impact, this can lead to cost savings in the long run, making it a win-win situation.

 Factors to Consider When Choosing Self-Storage for Architecture Projects 


 Image Source: blog.cfi.co

When searching for the perfect self-storage facility for your architecture projects, it’s essential to consider various factors to ensure you find the most suitable storage solutions. The right self-storage can be a life-saver for architects, providing hassle-free and easily accessible space to store valuable materials, models, and plans. Here are six crucial factors to consider during your search:

 1. Convenient Location and Accessibility 
Opt for a self-storage facility with locations near your business or project sites. Easy access will save you time and traffic headaches when you load or unload your architectural belongings. Consider a storage facility that offers convenient access hours to fit your busy schedule.

 2. Security and Safety Features 
The security and safety of your stored stuff is of utmost importance. Look for a storage facility with top-notch security measures, such as 24/7 surveillance, controlled access with personalized codes or key cards, and sturdy locks for your storage units .

 3. Storage Space and Unit Sizes 
Assess your storage needs and choose a facility that provides a variety of unit sizes to accommodate your architectural materials, models, and prototypes. Having flexible options allows you to rent the space that precisely fits your requirements, avoiding wasted space and unnecessary costs.

 4. Customer Service and Professional Assistance 
A storage facility committed to providing the best customer service can make all the difference. Look for a facility with helpful and professional staff who can assist you with renting, answer your questions, and deliver excellent communication throughout your storage journey.

 5. Affordable Pricing and Payment Options 
While self-storage is a convenient solution, it should also be affordable. Compare prices among different facilities and inquire about flexible payment options that fit your budget.

 6. Climate-Controlled Storage 
For sensitive architectural materials and documents, consider renting a climate-controlled unit. This feature protects your belongings from extreme temperature fluctuations, ensuring their preservation.

 Frequently Asked Questions on Self-Storage Solutions 


 Image Source: stor-it.com

 1. What are the most overlooked self-storage risks? 
Some of the most commonly overlooked risks when utilizing self-storage solutions include inadequate security measures, insufficient insurance coverage, and improper packing and organization. Failure to choose a reputable self-storage facility with robust security features can lead to theft and vandalism. Additionally, not having the right insurance coverage can leave stored belongings vulnerable in case of unforeseen events like fire or natural disasters. Poorly packed and organized items may be susceptible to damage or become difficult to access when needed.

 2. How much does storage cost? 
The cost of self-storage can vary depending on several factors, such as location, unit size, amenities, and rental duration. Storage costs may be higher in urban areas or cities than in rural locations. Larger storage units generally come with higher monthly fees compared to smaller ones. Climate-controlled units and additional services may also influence the overall cost. It’s best to contact the self-storage facility directly to get accurate pricing based on your specific needs.

 3. How do you organize a self-storage unit for frequent access? 
To optimize frequent access to a self-storage unit, consider these storage tips:

 
 Categorization and Labeling : Group similar materials and equipment together and assign clear and descriptive labels. Categorization allows for easy identification and retrieval, saving time during project execution. 
 Digital Inventory Tracking : Implement a digital inventory management system to track items in real time. Use spreadsheets, databases, or specialized inventory management software to maintain accurate records of stock levels, usage, and restocking needs. 
 Regular Audits : Conduct periodic audits to verify the accuracy of your inventory records. These audits help identify discrepancies, prevent stockouts, and minimize excess inventory. 
 Minimize Stockpiling : Avoid stockpiling excess materials unless necessary. It ties up capital and storage space, increasing the risk of outdated or damaged items. 
 Utilize Storage Containers and Shelving : Invest in high-quality storage containers, bins, and shelving units to maximize storage capacity and keep items organized. Clear storage bins allow easy visibility of contents, further improving accessibility. 
 Adopt a Color-Coding System : Use a color-coded system to differentiate between materials or project phases. This visual cue aids quick identification and reduces errors during storage and retrieval. 
 
 4. What is the most common self-storage size? 
The most common self-storage size is a 10\xd710 unit, which offers 100 square feet of space. This site is popular because it can accommodate the contents of a small one-bedroom apartment, making it suitable for individuals or small families. However, the most appropriate unit size depends on the specific storage needs of each customer. Some may require smaller units for a few boxes and personal items, while others might need larger units to store furniture and equipment from larger homes or businesses.

 Conclusion \xa0on Self-Storage Solutions 


 Image Source: storespace.com

Self-storage units serve as an innovative solution to the unique storage demands of architecture projects. From maintaining project efficiency and improving accessibility to cutting down on office clutter, these units offer numerous benefits. They present a versatile, secure, cost-effective option that architects shouldn’t overlook. With these advantages, it’s clear that self-storage units have the potential to streamline architecture projects significantly. \xa0

author: Hasan Chowdhury
title: La abogada de OpenAI dice que su cofundador, Ilya Sutskever, tenía demasiados archivos como para revelarlos en una demanda por derechos de autor
text: La abogada de OpenAI dice que su cofundador, Ilya Sutskever, tenía demasiados archivos como para revelarlos en una demanda por derechos de autor - OpenAI está intentando negociar una reducción del número de documentos que debe presentar en un proceso judicial de derechos de autor. Entre esos archivos se encontrarían los documentos del excientífico jefe de la startup, Ilya Sutskever. - La denuncia del Gremio de Autores de Estados Unidos se centra en sus alegaciones de que la desarrolladora de ChatGPT habría entrenado modelos de inteligencia artificial con libros de sus representados sin su consentimiento. Una de las abogadas de OpenAI está intentando negociar la reducción del número de documentos que la desarrolladora de ChatGPT debe revisar y hacer públicos con motivo de una denuncia por infracción de derechos de autor de alto rango, argumentando que [las últimas solicitudes que implican a su cofundador, Ilya Sutskever](https://www.businessinsider.es/openai-intenta-mantener-secreto-documentos-cofundador-ilya-sutskever-1404043), y a otros siete empleados y exempleados de la startup son demasiado grandes y numerosas. En una carta dirigida al juez encargado del caso presentada este miércoles en el tribunal federal de Nueva York, Estados Unidos, la abogada de [OpenAI](https://computerhoy.20minutos.es/tecnologia/openai-lanzara-nueva-ia-enero-todo-sabe-ahora-1418694), Carolyn M. Homer, ha asegurado que los archivos exigidos por el Gremio de Autores de EEUU a otras ocho personas sumarían cientos de gigabytes de datos "que comprenden más de 886.000 documentos". Entre esos ocho "custodios" —personas que se cree que tienen pruebas relevantes que presentar en el proceso de revelación previo al juicio— se encuentran Sutskever, antiguo científico jefe y cofundador de la startup de inteligencia artificial, y [Jan Leike](https://www.businessinsider.es/otro-directivo-openai-acaba-anunciar-marcha-1386587), el investigador de OpenAI que abandonó la empresa en mayo de este año para irse a la competencia, Anthropic. La demanda del Gremio de Autores se centra en las alegaciones de que los modelos de la desarrolladora de ChatGPT se habrían entrenado con libros sin el consentimiento de sus escritores. Homer también ha nombrado a otros custodios que se están viendo afectados por la denuncia, entre ellos los miembros del personal técnico de OpenAI, Chelsea Voss, Shantanu Jani y Jong Wook Kim, el responsable de los datos de preentrenamiento, Qiming Yuan, y los extrabajadores, Andrew Mayne y Cullen O'Keefe. La compañía dirigida por [Sam Altman](https://www.businessinsider.es/tecnologia/sam-altman-agradece-elon-musk-ayuda-inversion-inicial-openai-dice-avecinan-buenos-tiempos-fundadores-tecnologicos-1418278) ya ha accedido a presentar archivos de 24 custodios, pero se opone a los parámetros de búsqueda propuestos y a las peticiones de presentar documentos de ocho nuevos custodios por temor a que sus archivos aumenten significativamente los recursos necesarios para examinarlos. Según la abogada de OpenAI, la revisión de los 24 custodios existentes por parte de la empresa, basada en sus propios términos de búsqueda propuestos, le exigiría analizar "más de 460.000 documentos" que suman 359 gigabytes. Homer ha afirmado que, utilizando los términos propuestos por el Gremio de Autores, la compañía de IA necesitaría revisar más de 1 millón de documentos. Al tener en cuenta los términos de búsqueda propuestos por OpenAI para los ocho custodios en disputa, la abogada ha señalado que el tamaño de los archivos sería de más de 375 gigabytes, superando el tamaño de los archivos de los 24 custodios ya acordados por ambas partes. Homer también ha expresado que la desarrolladora de ChatGPT estimó una tasa de duplicación del 71% basándose en los términos de búsqueda propuestos entre los ocho custodios en disputa y los 24 existentes. La abogada de OpenAI ha indicado que el "importante volumen de consultas", así como la preocupación por las altas tasas de duplicación, supone que la organización va a seguir intentando llegar a un acuerdo con los demandantes con respecto a los archivos de Sutskever y los otros custodios en disputa. Esta polémica marca el último avance en la demanda colectiva presentada por el Gremio de Autores contra OpenAI. Documentos no confidenciales a los que [Business Insider](https://www.businessinsider.com/openai-destroyed-ai-training-datasets-lawsuit-authors-books-copyright-2024-5) tuvo acceso hace unos meses revelaron que la startup eliminó dos conjuntos de datos, "books1" y "books2", que fueron utilizados para entrenar su anterior modelo de inteligencia artificial, [GPT-3](https://www.businessinsider.es/openai-lanza-mejor-herramienta-lenguaje-artificial-escrito-682351). OpenAI también se enfrenta a otros casos de posible infracción de derechos de autor, incluido [uno presentado por el New York Times](https://www.businessinsider.es/abogados-new-york-times-estan-inspeccionando-sala-secreta-codigo-openai-1410913). Los abogados del Gremio de Autores estadounidense han declarado que los conjuntos de datos utilizados por la empresa de Altman pueden haber incluido "más de 100.000 libros publicados". Este medio de comunicación ha tratado de ponerse en contacto con OpenAI y con el Gremio de Autores de Estados Unidos, pero de momento no ha obtenido respuesta. Conoce [cómo trabajamos](/como-trabajamos) en BusinessInsider. Etiquetas: [Trending](https://www.businessinsider.es/tags/trending), [Inteligencia artificial](https://www.businessinsider.es/tags/inteligencia-artificial), [Justicia](https://www.businessinsider.es/tags/justicia), [ChatGPT](https://www.businessinsider.es/tags/chatgpt), [Estados Unidos](https://www.businessinsider.es/tags/estados-unidos), [OpenAI](https://www.businessinsider.es/tags/openai)

organizations.name: Gremio de Autores de Estados Unidos
